description: Whisk together vinegar and oil and stir in caraway seed. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over cheese and let stand for about 10 minutes and serve.

title: Bagna Cauda

title: Tuna with Arugula

Brush all around with oil and cook on the hot grill 2 - 3 minutes, so that the center of the fish remains raw. Cut the fish into thick slices, each about 1 cm (approximately 1/3 inch) and place on the salad. Serve with sea salt.

title: Tuna Fish Tartare
description: Divide tuna fish tartare onto spoons and garnish with chervil to serve.

title: Vitello Tonnato

title: Meatballs with Spicy Olive Sauce

title: Fried Coconut Chicken
description: Dip the chicken pieces in egg and coat with coconut. Fry, in batches, in hot oil 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve garnished as desired with lettuce and onions.

title: Tuna with Onions

Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan and sauté onions for 1-2 minutes. Deglaze the saucepan with wine and fish stock. Add golden raisins and olives, mix and simmer over medium heat for about 10 minutes. description: Serve the guacamole with grilled flatbread on the side.

title: Asian Salmon
description: Rinse salmon, pat dry and cut into 8 pieces. Place salmon pieces in a shallow dish and drizzle with soy sauce marinade. Let stand for about 15 minutes.

title: Garlic Steak
description: Rinse meat, pat dry and fry in a hot pan for 2 minutes on each side (longer or shorter depending on the desired degree of cooking). Then cook under a preheated oven broiler, watching carefully, on the wire rack (including drip pan) for about 10 minutes. Place steaks on plates, pour garlic sauce over top and serve garnished with cilantro leaves.

title: Mackerel with Cucumber
description: Rinse mackerel fillets, pat dry and cut into 12 roughly equal pieces. Place fish, skin-side down, on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Mix together chili sauce, curry paste, lime juice and oil. Brush mixture on fish and bake about 5 minutes.

title: Various Spiced Oils
description: Blanch the chile peppers in boiling water. Drain, pat dry and halve lengthwise. Place in a third bottle (about 0.5 liters) (approximately 16 ounces). Fill each with the oil, so that all the ingredients are completely covered.

title: Bell Pepper and Mozzarella Salad
description: Drain the mozzarella and cut into slices. Arrange the peppers on a plate and spread the mozzarella on it. Pluck the thyme and sprinkle on top.

title: Herb-Mustard Dressing
description: Whisk well until the sugar and salt have dissolved. Gradually incorporate the oil, stirring constantly. Add enough oil until a thick dressing has formed. Mix in the herbs, season to taste, and serve.

title: Herb Pesto
description: Place the herbs, pine nuts and garlic in a blender and puree. Incorporate the oil until a creamy pesto is created. Add the lemon zest, lemon juice and Parmesan. If necessary, stir in some cold water and season with salt and pepper.

title: Cabbage Rolls with Chicken and Peanut Sauce
description: Rinse peppers, drain and pat dry and cut out stem and seeds and ribs and dice finely. Rinse scallion, drain and pat dry and cut into small rings. Chop nuts.

title: Oysters with Herb Sauce
description: Rinse and open the oysters. Drain the water and loosen the oyster meat with the knife (but leave in the shell). Spread the pesto over the oyster and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Place on the hot grill and cook for 5-6 minutes until the cheese begins to melt. Serve.

title: Roast Beef with Peppercorns
description: Serve beef with a melon salad, if desired.

title: Carpaccio
description: To serve the thin slices, stir 1 tablespoon olive oil with the lemon juice and brush each plate with a little lemon oil. Arrange the beef slices slightly overlapping on the brushed area.

title: Spicy Pork Meatballs
description: Serve meatballs with chile and lemon zest oil.

title: Deviled Eggs
description: Spoon the filling back into the eggs or place in a piping bag with a serrated nozzle and pipe the filling into the eggs.

title: Scotch Eggs
description: Wrap each hard boiled egg in the pork mixture. Whisk the remaining egg and place the remaining breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Dip the pork covered eggs into the egg then coat well with breadcrumbs. Fry the eggs in hot oil for 2-4 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve warm.

title: Waldorf Salad
description: Rinse apples, remove core and cut into thin slices. Rinse and slice celery. Chop walnuts.

title: Turkey Roulades
description: Remove from the pan, arrange on plates and garnish with herbs. Serve.

title: Turkey Escalopes with Zucchini
description: Combine 100 ml (approximately 2/5 cup) of cream with broth and mustard, bring to a boil and reduce heat, simmer until creamy. Add green peppercorns. Mix egg yolks with remaining cream and gradually add to the sauce, whisking. Remove from heat and season with salt, keep warm.

title: Feta Cheese Sauce
description: Garnish the sauce with the remaining rosemary, and serve.

title: Garlic Dip with Ginger
description: Cook about half the garlic in the butter until light brown, sprinkle with soy sauce, dust with turmeric and let stand briefly, then remove from heat and let cool.

title: Poached Egg with Mushrooms
description: Cut baguettes in half crosswise. Cut halves into 15 strips and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Grate cheese over strips. Broiler for about 5 minutes to crisp, watching carefully.

title: Fish with Asparagus En Papillote
description: Remove from the oven and transfer to plates. Uncover carefully and serve garnished with basil.

title: Herb Chicken
description: Wash the chicken and pat dry. Rinse the herbs and shake dry. Pluck a few of the leaves and chop. Rinse the lemon and cut in half. Squeeze one-half for juice and cut the other half into slices. Peel the shallots and cut into eighths. Peel and mince the garlic. Season the inside of the chicken with salt and pepper. Fill with the shallots, lemon slices, garlic, and all the unchopped herbs. Tie the legs together. Whisk the lemon juice with the honey, olive oil, salt, pepper, and the chopped herbs. Brush the chicken with the dressing.

title: Smoked Fish Salad
description: Spread small ladles (cover with plastic wrap, if desired) with salmon slices and fill with salad. Carefully transfer to plates and serve.

title: Salmon with Vegetables En Papillote
description: Brush four sufficiently large pieces of parchment paper with oil.

title: White Asparagus with Cream Sauce
description: Peel asparagus. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large pot. Add asparagus and season with salt and sugar. Pour in broth, cover and cook for 13-15 minutes.

title: Poached Fish
description: Rinse and pat dry fish, add to the pot and simmer at just below the boiling point at about 80°C (approximately 175°F) for about 10-15 minutes. Remove from a slotted spoon and serve with mustard sauce, if desired.

title: Stir Fried Pork
description: Heat peanut oil in wok and fry pork with ginger and garlic for 1-2 minutes while stirring occasionally. Slide pork to the edge of the wok and place carrots in the middle of the wok. Fry for about 1 minute, mix with pork and push mixture back to the edge. Place cabbage in the center, saute briefly, mix with remaining ingredients and fry for 1-2 minutes. Add soy sauce mixture and sesame oil, mix and bring to a boil and season with lime juice.

title: Lamb Chops with Raspberry Sauce
description: Rinse rosemary, shake dry and pluck off leaves from 1 sprig. Chop finely and whisk with remaining oil. Rinse chops, pat dry and sprinkle with rosemary oil. Grill on a hot grill for 3-5 minutes per side. Top with remaining rosemary and season with salt. Arrange on plates and drizzle with raspberry sauce. Serve.

title: Chicken Soup with Vegetables
description: Rinse the carrots, celery and leeks, and peel and trim as needed. Cut the carrots and the leeks in half lengthwise and set half aside. Cut the leeks in half crosswise and tie into a bundle with kitchen twine along with half of the carrots halves and half of the celery. Place the onion half in a dry frying pan with the cut surface down and cook until dark brown. Press the bay leaves and cloves into the onion.

title: Grilled Patties with Corn
description: Rinse bell pepper and scallion. Cut into small pieces.

title: Shrimp on Toast
description: Heat some butter and sweat the onion until soft. Add the spinach and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Stir in the shrimp, heat through and season with salt, pepper, lemon juice and parsley.

title: Mini Meatballs
description: To serve, spear on toothpicks if desired.

title: Lamb Chops
description: Remove chops from the marinade and drain. Whisk yogurt into marinade.

title: Clams in White Wine
description: Add drained clams. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes, until the shells have opened (discard any closed shells) and season with salt and pepper. Remove clams from the saucepan and serve on plates garnished with remaining oregano.

title: Beef Stock
description: Meanwhile, peel the carrots, celery and 2 onions and chop coarsely. Remove the outer layer of the third onion and cut in half. Place the onion halves in a hot pan with the cut surfaces down and cook until golden brown. Skim the foam off the top of the broth from time. Place the chopped vegetables and onion halves in the pot after about 1 hour.

title: Chicken Skewers
description: Thread onto skewers, season with a little salt and place on the hot grill and cook about 5 minutes or until done. Remove and serve.

title: Fish Patties
description: Add eggs, herbs and horseradish to fish together with enough breadcrumbs to make malleable mixture. Season with salt, lemon juice and pepper and make 16-20 small patties.

title: Pan Roasted Salmon
description: Rinse the salmon and pat dry with paper towels. Heat the oil in a pan. Add the salmon to the pan, and cook for 2 minutes, until golden brown. Turn the salmon using a spatula, and cook for 2 minutes on the other side. Decrease the temperature in the pan, and add the butter. Add the prepared ingredients to the pan. Cook the salmon another minute longer, then turn again. Baste the salmon with the butter, and cook the salmon until it's done.

title: Roast Chicken
description: Rinse chicken thoroughly, pat dry, trim as necessary and season inside with salt and pepper. Tie legs together with kitchen twine. Place breast-side up in a roasting pan and cook in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes.

title: Baked Pollock with Cooseberry Sauce
description: Divide fish fillet into four portions and arrange on a lined with parchment paper baking pan. Spread herb mixture on top and bake in preheated oven  at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 12 minutes.

title: Fish on Bed of Vegetables
description: Remove foil, season to taste and serve.

title: Marinated Zucchini and Bell Peppers
description: Zest lime and squeeze juice. Reserve some lime juice. Mix zest, juice and black cumin seeds with zucchini and bell peppers and marinate for at least 30 minutes. Season with salt, cayenne pepper and remaining lime juice. Garnish with parsley before serving.

title: Grilled Shrimp Skewers
description: Rinse lemon thyme sprigs and pat dry. Alternately stick mango cubes, tomatoes, shrimps and thyme sprigs on 12 skewers and sprinkle with soy sauce. Drizzle skewers with oil, cook under a preheated oven broiler, watching carefully, until golden brown and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Serve with mango chutney if desired.

title: Lemon Fish with Vegetables
description: Rinse beans, drain and snip off ends. Rinse fennel, cut in half, trim and thinly slice. Rinse scallions and cut into chunks. Peel garlic and cut into slices. Slice lemon and lime. Rinse fish, pat dry and cut into 4 pieces. Place in center of a piece of parchment paper measuring 30 x 30 cm (approximately 12 x 12 inches). Top with vegetables, garlic and dill. Spread citrus slices on top. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Pour wine over and pull edges of paper together. Twist ends together to form a closed pocket. Place on a baking sheet and cook for 15-20 minutes.

title: Creamed Spinach
description: Rinse the spinach in a colander. Pat dry, and remove any hard stems. Set one handful of the spinach aside.

title: Lime-Ginger Marinade
description: This marinade goes well with fish. Place four 200 g (approximately 7 ounces) fish such as bream in a baking dish. Cover with the marinade, and let marinate for at least 1 hour.

title: Poached Cod
description: Squeeze the juice from the lemon into a pot with about 1 liter (approximately 4 cups) hot water. Add 1 teaspoon salt, the peppercorns and bay leaves and simmer for 10 minutes over low heat.

title: Scrambled Eggs
description: This recipe calls for 8 eggs, although you can increase the amount to 10 eggs if you have very hungry guests.

title: Omelet
description: Gather all of the ingredients.

title: Roasted Sea Bass
description: Rinse arugula, shake dry, cut out stems and chop leaves. Whisk quark with cream and arugula. Season with 1 pinch of lemon zest, a little bit of lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Roast Turkey Roulade with Bell Peppers
description: Peel the onion and garlic and finely dice. Sauté together with the chopped vegetables in a large pan in 2 tablespoons hot oil for about 1 minute. Sprinkle in the coconut flakes. Whisk the egg and mix with the vegetables. Season with 1-2 tablespoons soy sauce and pepper, then remove from the heat.

title: Fish Gratin with Vegetables
description: Rinse parsley and thyme and shake dry. Pluck off leaves and chop finely. Rinse zucchini, trim the ends and grate coarsely. Peel potatoes and grate a little finer. Combine potatoes, zucchini, mozzarella and Gouda, season with salt and pepper.

title: Stuffed Chicken
description: Rinse chicken thoroughly and pat dry. Peel garlic and press into a bowl. Add rosemary, lemon juice and cream cheese. Mix and season with salt and pepper. Carefully peel skin from chicken, starting at the neck, to loosen. Add a thin layer of cream cheese mixture throughout chicken in between meat and skin. Rinse lemon in hot water and pat dry. Cut into quarters and then slices. Add remaining cream cheese mixture to chicken cavity along with lemon slices. Close openings with toothpicks. Place chicken breast-side up in a roasting pan and roast for 60 minutes. Season butter with salt and pepper and baste chicken about every 10 minutes.

title: Crispy Chicken Skewers
description: Coarsely crumble chips. Roll chicken skewers in crushed chips. Cook chicken skewers under a preheated oven broiler, watching carefully, for 5-6 minutes until golden brown. Turn occasionally as needed. Serve immediately.

title: Fish Carpaccio
description: Rinse the cherries, remove the stems and seeds, and cut into slices. Arrange the cherries over the top of the fish and drizzle with the remaining dressing. Garnish with the dill and pink pepper, and serve.

title: Herb Dressing
description: Mix the vinegar with the mustard, shallots, the oil, and the herbs. Place in a small jar, and stir or shake until thoroughly combined. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and sugar.

title: Yogurt Dressing
description: Mix the yogurt with 1-2 teaspoons of lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest, a little cold water, the mustard, and the chives. Season to taste with salt, pepper, lemon juice, and sugar.

title: Meatballs with Peppers
description: Soak bread in a little warm water. Blanch tomatoes in boiling water, rinse, peel, remove seeds and stalks and chop pulp finely. Rinse both bell peppers, remove seeds and ribs and chop. Place some yellow bell pepper cubes and diced tomatoes aside. Peel shallot, finely chop and saute together with remaining bell peppers in 1-2 teaspoons of hot oil for 2-3 minutes. Remove from pan and mix with ground beef, egg, diced tomatoes and expressed bread. Knead into a smooth mixture, adding breadcrumbs if needed. Season with salt and cayenne. Using wet hands, form into meatballs and cook in remaining oil for 8-10 minutes, turning as needed.

title: Fried Anchovies
description: For the fish, rinse anchovies and pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with flour. Heat oil in a large pan and fry fish for 2-3 minutes until crispy. Drain on absorbent paper towel. Serve with the rouille.

title: Tomatoes Stuffed with Tofu
description: Heat oil in a pan and fry remaining thyme with bay leaves briefly. Add tomatoes, season with salt and pepper and simmer, covered, for about 15 minutes on low heat. If necessary, add a little water to the pan.

title: Avocado Cream
description: Halve the avocados, remove the seeds, and scoop out the pulp. Add the avocado, remaining pistachios, and the peeled garlic to the blender. Add the lime juice to the blender, and puree completely. Mix in the sour cream, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the avocado cream garnished with the pistachio-mint mixture.

title: Creamy Pea Puree
description: Puree the remaining cucumber with the peas, lemon zest, remaining thyme, and remaining sour cream. The amount of sour cream may vary slightly, depending on the desired consistency. Season the puree with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

title: Chicken Curry
description: Heat the ghee in a large saucepan and sauté the onions. Add the cloves and cardamom mixture and saute. Add the chicken, the garlic and ginger and saute for 3-5 minutes while stirring. Then stir in the coriander, allspice, cumin and turmeric and cook 2-3 more minutes. Add the tomato paste and almonds and pour in the broth. Stir in the cream and bring to a boil. Let simmer over low heat about 20 minutes until creamy. Season with salt and serve garnished with cilantro leaves.

title: T-bone Steak
description: Lightly crush colorful pepper in a mortar. Rinse meat and pat dry. Heat oil in two large pans and fry steaks for approximately 1 minute on each side. Add garlic and rosemary to the pans and sauté together with the meat while turning for about 10 minutes and season with salt and pepper. Remove steaks from the pan, let rest briefly and then serve.

title: Ricotta Mousse with Pesto
description: Mix the ricotta with the lemon zest until smooth. Beat the cream until stiff, then add to the ricotta mixture. Mix in half of the pesto, and then season to taste with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

title: Chicken Breast with Mustard Butter
description: Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Cook, skin side down, in a hot pan in oil for about 5 minutes until golden brown. Turn and cook another 4-5 minutes until done. Brush with the oil while cooking.

title: Smoked Salmon Cake
description: Beat eggs in a bowl with crème fraîche and thyme and season with nutmeg, pepper and a little salt. Pour into a tart pan or baking dish that has been lined with parchment paper. Tear salmon apart with a fork, spread over \egg mixture, cover with pieces of butter and bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes until golden brown.

title: Sea Bass with Carrots
description: Rinse fish fillets, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a nonstick pan and cook fish for about 2-3 minutes on one side or until golden brown. Turn over and remove pan from the heat, cook for 1-2 minutes more.

title: Grilled Broccoli
description: Peel and thinly slice the garlic. Rinse and halve the chili. Trim the chili and finely dice. Dry the anchovy with a paper towel, then finely dice. Sauté the anchovy, garlic, and chili in the remaining oil until the garlic is golden brown. Pour the garlic mixture over the broccoli and toss until combined. Mix in the lemon juice, then season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Grilled Tomatoes with Mozzarella
description: Remove tomatoes from the vine, rinse and drain. Cover a baking dish with 1 tablespoon oil and add tomatoes. Mix 1 tablespoon oil in a bowl with vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Pour oil and vinegar mixture over tomatoes. Bake tomatoes for about 10 minutes under the preheated oven broiler, watching carefully, until soft.

title: Artichokes with Dressing
description: For the aioli: Peel and press the garlic cloves. Combine the egg yolks, the mustard, a pinch of salt and pepper in a large bowl. Beat until white and creamy. Add a few drops of oil to begin. Then add the rest, beating constantly so that all of the oil is combined before adding more. Stir in the lemon juice. Season with salt.

title: Radish and Leek Salad with Chicken
description: Peel the radish and thinly slice. Rinse the leeks. Cut the light end into rings and the green end into thin strips. Rinse the parsley, shake dry and coarsely chop the leaves.

title: Baked Tomatoes with Cheese
description: 50 mins

title: Chicken Kebabs
description: Remove the outer leaves from the remaining lemongrass stalks and cut the ends into a point for better skewering.

title: Artichoke Flan
description: Preheat the convection oven to 120°C (approximately 200°F).

title: Pork Bacon Skewers with Vegetables
description: Rinse and peel the remaining zucchini and peppers. Cut the zucchini diagonally into slices and the peppers into wide strips. Peel the onions and cut into wedges.

title: Chicken with Herbs
description: Rinse chicken, pat dry, cut along the back and unfold. Place on the oven rack (with drip tray below). Mix lemon juice in a bowl with oil, red pepper flakes and salt. Brush chicken with lemon juice mixture. Bake on the preheated oven for about 45 minutes. Brush with lemon juice mixture during the cooking time as needed. During the last 10 minutes of cooking, mix herbs with lemon juice mixture and coat chicken with it.

title: Vinaigrette
description: Arrange all the ingredients on a work surface. Peel the shallot and remove any of the root if it is still intact. Measure both the oil and the vinegar.

title: Green Salad with Tomato and Egg
description: For the vinaigrette, mix vinegar in a bowl olive oil and grapeseed oil. Whisk in onions and season with salt, pepper and a pinch of sugar. Arrange the lettuce leaves on a plate and cover with eggs and tomatoes. Sprinkle with diced bell peppers and then drizzle with the vinaigrette. Serve if desired, garnished with chives.

title: Steamed Fennel with Nuts and Egg
description: Toast nuts in a dry pan until fragrant, then remove from heat, let cool and chop coarsely. Rinse the parsley, shake dry, pluck leaves and chop coarsely. Stir together vinegar, mustard, orange juice and oils. Season with salt, pepper and honey to taste and stir in the parsley. Divide the fennel on plates and drizzle with the dressing. Sprinkle the eggs and nuts over the fennel and season with pepper. Serve garnished with fennel leaves.

title: Smoked Trout and Avocado Salad
description: Rinse the watercress and pat dry. Rinse, trim and cut the radishes into very thin slices. Cut the trout into pieces. Peel the avocado, remove the pit and cut the flesh into pieces. Arrange all salad ingredients on plates. Serve with the drizzled dressing.

title: Fried Green Tomatoes
description: For the garnish: Crosswise cut the skin of the tomatoes. Blanch in boiling water for 1 minutes. Rinse in cold water and peel. Cut or crush the tomatoes very small. Rinse the tomatoes and dice finely. Rinse the spring onion and cut into thin rings. Peel the garlic.

title: Smoked Trout with Spinach
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pan and sauté the spinach briefly. Remove from heat and transfer to a large bowl. Whisk the balsamic vinegar with the remaining olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle the dressing over the spinach and mix until well coated. Remove the smoked trout from the oven and plate with the spinach and sliced tomatoes. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

title: Light Spring Soup with Egg Custard
description: For the soup, rinse, peel and cut carrots into decorative slices. Rinse and cut bell pepper into thin strips. Bring the vegetable stock to a boil. Add the carrots and cook for 3 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook 2 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper. Rinse chives, shake dry and cut in half. Unmold egg custard onto a board and cut into small diamond shapes. Serve egg custard ​in the soup and garnish with chives.

title: Bouillabaisse
description: Add the fish carcasses and continue cooking.

title: Salmon Soup with Pike Dumplings
description: For the dumplings: Cut pike into small pieces and puree liberally in an electric blender. Stir egg whites and crème fraîche into the pike puree. Season with salt, pepper and lemon zest. If the mixture is too wet, mix in breadcrumbs. Chill in the refrigerator.

title: Roast Guinea Fowl with Potato Straws
description: Rinse herbs and pat dry. Place herbs on the flesh side of the meat and tie with kitchen twine.

title: Perch with Wasabi and Vegetables
description: Rinse fish fillets, pat dry and cut into 4 portions. Cut chili pepper finely. Heat remaining oil in a pan. Fry fish skin side down for 3 minutes then add chili. Turn fish, add butter in the pan, remove pan from heat and cook for 2-3 minutes. Serve fish with chili butter and rutabaga. Serve with wild long grain rice as desired.

title: Salmon Potato Cubes with Horseradish Cream
description: For the horseradish cream, mix creme fraiche, double cream, horseradish and dill and season with lemon juice, salt and pepper. For garnish, decorate horseradish cream with dill and serve with the salmon potato cubes.

title: Chicken Breast on Spinach
description: Heat the olive oil and sauté the spinach, onion and garlic. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Beef in Shallot and Mustard Sauce
description: Heat the oil and butter. Fry the beef briefly on both sides, remove and set aside. Fry the shallots until soft. Stir in the mustard and honey. Pour in the beef stock and cream. Simmer for 15 minutes covered.

title: Poached Eggs with Cucumber and Cress Vinaigrette
description: Rinse cucumber, pat dry and cut lengthwise, then finely dice. Stir cucumber, mustard and capers into scallion mixture. Season with salt, pepper and sugar. With kitchen shears, cut cress from 1 box and add to mixture.

description: Peel onion, chop finely and stir into marinade with remaining oil. Brush pork cutlets with marinade, cover and refrigerate for 2-3 horus.

description: Rinse chile peppers and dice finely. Peel garlic and chop coarsely. Combine fish sauce with lime juice, oil, chile peppers and garlic and mash coarsely. Season with pepper.

title: Stir-Fried Wasabi Duck
description: Dust duck breast with cornstarch. Add soybean oil to a wok, heat and fry duck breast, then push meat to edge of wok. Add carrots and cook for 2–3 minutes while stirring. Slide carrots to edge of wok, add snow peas and cook for 1–2 minutes. Add bean sprouts, mix everything and deglaze with sake.

title: Beef Broth with Ham Dumplings
description: For the dumplings: Grate bread. Mince ham. Peel and mince shallots. Rinse parsley, shake dry and mince. Separate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff. Beat butter until creamy. Combine butter, egg yolk, bread, flour, milk, shallots, parsley and ham. Season with salt and pepper. Fold in whites. Spread mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment and bake in an oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) for 30-35 minutes. Remove, let cool and cut into diamond shapes.

title: Duck Breast
description: Deglaze drippings with grapefruit juice and duck stock. Stir in honey and simmer for about 5 minutes. Mix cornstarch with a little cold water until smooth, stir into the sauce and simmer for about 1 minute to thicken. Season with salt and pepper and remove cloves.

title: Elderflower Ice Cream
description: For the ice cream: Combine egg yolk and sugar syrup, then stir in elderberry juice and lemon juice. Stir in buttermilk. Chill for 1 hour.

title: Layered Asparagus Mousse
description: Peel bottoms of green asparagus and remove hard ends. Cook in boiling asparagus water for 5 minutes. Spread on a plate to cool. Cut off asparagus tips and set aside.

title: Appetizer Plates with Crayfish
description: Combine egg yolks with lemon juice, salt, pepper and sugar in a mixing bowl with a whisk. Gradually drizzle in oil, mixing in asparagus cooking water at the end. Season with salt and pepper. Rinse herbs, shake dry and cut leaves finely. Mix half with salad dressing.

title: Asparagus Soup with Prawns
description: Remove asparagus, drain and cut into pieces. Pour asparagus through a sieve. Set aside asparagus tips.

title: Creamy Brussels Sprout Soup with Smoked Salmon
description:
Remove three Brussels sprouts heads and set aside. Puree other
vegetables and potatoes with a hand blender in the stock. Add stock if the soup is too thick. Beat cream until stiff. Cut the salmon into thin strips. Add sprout heads back.

title: Grilled Lamb Cutlets
description: Rinse lamb chops, pat dry and brush with half of marinade. Cover and let stand for 1 hour.

title: Leek Soup with Prosciutto and Pesto
description: Toast the pumpkin seeds in a dry pan until golden brown. Rinse the tomatoes, cut into quarters, remove the seeds and dice. Add the tomatoes to the soup and season with salt, pepper and a pinch of sugar.
